meanings.definition: To cover or coat with zinc.
meanings.sent1: The workers zinkified the metal sheets for protection.
meanings.sent2: The builders zinkified the roof to prevent rusting.
meanings.sent3: The superhero zinkified his shield to make it indestructible.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter zinkified the room, filling it with joy.
meanings.sent5: The artist zinkified the sculpture, giving it a shiny finish.

meanings.definition: To treat or preserve with zinc.
meanings.sent1: The doctor zinkified the wound to prevent infection.
meanings.sent2: The chef zinkified the food cans to extend their shelf life.
meanings.sent3: The magician zinkified his hat to keep it looking new.
meanings.sent4: His words zinkified her heart, keeping their bond strong.
meanings.sent5: The gardener zinkified the plant pots, ensuring they lasted longer.

meanings.definition: To become coated or treated with zinc.
meanings.sent1: Over time, the metal zinkified due to exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent2: The old fence zinkified, showing a shiny surface after treatment.
meanings.sent3: The toy car zinkified itself magically, surprising the child.
meanings.sent4: Her smile zinkified, radiating happiness to everyone around.
meanings.sent5: The statue zinkified in the rain, creating a unique patina over time.
